name: Borel conjecture
summary: The Borel conjecture is a statement in geometric topology that asserts closed aspherical manifolds with isomorphic fundamental groups are homeomorphic. It is a statement of "topological rigidity," meaning that a weaker algebraic equivalence (homotopy equivalence) implies a stronger topological equivalence (homeomorphism). In essence, it claims that a manifold is determined by its fundamental group, up to homeomorphism.
head: Two closed, aspherical manifolds have isomorphic fundamental groups (or, equivalently, are homotopy equivalent).
